'''Health research:''' all studies aimed at developing biological or medical knowledge, to extend scientific understanding of human beings and develop actions likely to improve health.

There are three levels of organisation in France:

*decision-making'' (Ministries of Health and Research, the exact titles of which may vary from one government to another) to define the major strategic orientations, organisation and allocation of macroscopic resources;
*programming'' to allocate resources (general agencies such as the French National Research Agency (ANR), or specific agencies such as the French National Cancer Institute (INCa), or the French National Agency for Research on AIDS and Viral Hepatitis - Emerging Infectious Diseases (ANRS-MIE), for example).
*operators'' to manage laboratories and organise research (national research bodies such as INSERM and CNRS, universities, teaching hospitals, etc.).

question.title: What is the primary level of organisation in France?
question.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option

option_a.title: Decision-making
option_a.description: This is the highest level of organisation in France, responsible for defining strategic orientations and resource allocation.

option_b.title: Programming
option_b.description: This level of organisation is responsible for allocating resources, such as general agencies or specific agencies.

option_c.title: Operators
option_c.description: This level of organisation is responsible for managing laboratories and organising research.

option_d.title: Research
option_d.description: This is the lowest level of organisation in France, responsible for conducting research.

correct_option.title: Decision-making
correct_option.description: This is the primary level of organisation in France, responsible for defining strategic orientations and resource allocation.
